alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Hyde and Dare Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sanderling to Mashoes to near Fort Landing. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kill Devil Hills, Stumpy Point, Southern Shores, Salvo, Manns Harbor, Waves, Nags Head, Rodanthe, Mashoes, Manteo, East Lake, Sanderling, Colington, Whalebone, Buffalo City, Roanoke Island Festival Park, Nags Head Fishing Pier, Bodie Island Lighthouse, Duck and Jockeys Ridge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Hatteras Island; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Northern Outer Banks
